thread.title: Classical Concerts weekend of Oct. 23-25
thread.title_full: Classical Concerts weekend of Oct. 23-25 - Entertainment & Life - providencejournal.com - Providence, RI

author:
Jan Flanaganâ€©
Journal Staff Writer
title: Classical Concerts weekend of Oct. 23-25
text: FRIDAY, SUNDAY Salt Marsh Opera: Mashantucket Pequot Museum Auditorium, 110 Pequot Trail, Mashantucket, Conn. (860) 535-0753; saltmarshopera.org . Puccini's "Madame Butterfly." Simon Holt directing and featuring soprano Ashley Kerr and tenor Brian Cheney. Fri 7:30 p.m., Sun 3 p.m. $55. Warwick Symphony Orchestra: wsori.org . "A Patchwork Symphony," works by Mendelssohn, Dvorak and Beethoven. $10, children 11 and younger free. Fri: Scottish Rite Auditorium, 2115 Broad St., Cranston, 7:30 p.m. Sun: Greenwich Odeum, 59 Main St., East Greenwich, 3 p.m. SATURDAY Brown University Chorus: Brown's Sayles Hall, Main Green, Waterman and George streets, Providence. 863-3234; brown.edu/academics/music/events . "Music of the Stars and Sea," 8 p.m. $10, students $3. Heifetz Concert: Jamestown Arts Center, 18 Valley St., Jamestown. 560-0979; jamestownartcenter.org; heifetzinstitute.org . Featuring violinist Chloe Kiffer, violist Erica Gailing, cellist Mo Mo with pianist Hsin-Chiao Liao. 7:30 p.m. $30, 25 and younger $15. Organist Peter Krasinski: Church of St. John the Evangelist, 61 Popular St., Newport. 848-2561; saintjohns-newport.org krasinski.org . "PipeScreams on the Point," family-friendly Halloween organ recital with "wacky overtones." Works by Bach and screening of the 1925 silent horror film, "The Phantom of the Opera" with live organ accompaniment. Choristers from The Choir School of Newport County will sing during the Masked Ball scene. 6:30 p.m. Costumes welcome. A second screen with video monitor will show the organist and organ mechanisms during the music and movie. Pipe chamber tours after the concert. $5 donation suggested; family maximum $15. Keyboard Player Owen Trainor: South Kingstown Public Library, 1057 Kingstown Rd., Wakefield. 789-1555, ext. 110; skpl.org . "Old-Time Rhode Island Sing-Along," music from the early 1900s. 2 p.m. Free. SUNDAY Pianist/Vocalist Ethan Bortnick: Rhode Island College, Sapinsley Hall, 600 Mount Pleasant Ave., Providence. bit.ly/1OEUuxV . "The Power of Music," music ranging from The Beatles to Elton John to Broadway, from Chopin to Neil Diamond, from Michael Jackson to Motown to rock 'n roll and everything in between. With guest Damian McGinty, a band, a chi ldren's choir and local guest artists. 3 p.m. $39-$49. Fall River Symphony: Bristol Community College, 777 Elsbree St., Fall River. (508) 642-6837; orchestrafallriver@gmail.com ; fallriversymphonyorchestra.org . Douglas McRay Daniels directing and featuring The Neave Trio. Works by Beethoven and Dvorak. 3 p.m. Page 2 of 2 - Eden Macadam-Somer: Roger Williams University, Performing Arts Center, One Old Ferry Rd., Bristol. 254-3626; rwu.edu . Voice, violin, violist, percussive dance. With Enigmatica, a plucked string ensemble. 2 p.m. Free. Musica Dolce: Lutheran Church of the Good Shepherd, 383 Old North Rd., Kingston. 578-2676, (508) 280-7983 or bunnycello@yahoo.com . Works by Mozart, Beethoven and Bridge. 2 p.m. Free; donations welcome to benefit South County Habitat Faith Build house under construction in Exeter. Narragansett Bay Symphony Community Orchestra: Providence College, Smith Center for the Arts, One Cunningham Square, Providence. 274-4578; nabsco.org . Benjamin Vickers directing and featuring pianist Eric Mazonson. Works by Jennifer Higdon, Gershwin and Borodin. 3 p.m. $15, students/seniors $5. Donations of nonperishable food items appreciated to benefit the Rhode Island Food Bank. "Sing Out For Peace!": Temple Habonim, 165 New Meadow Rd., Barrington. templehabonim.org . Interfaith event featuring music, dance, spoken word and prayer from different faith traditions and cultures is a multicultural celebration aspiring to bring diverse communities together in the spirit of peace and mutual respect. Featuring Prafulla Velury, Waleed Muhammad, The Ruach Singers and The Prism of Praise Community Gospel Choir. 4 p.m. Donations appreciated. Proceeds to benefit Rhode Island for Community and Justice. Keyboard Player John Read: Trinity Brewhouse, 186 Fountain St., Providence. "Beer & Hymns" in conjunction with Immanuel Lutheran Church, Attleboro. 4:30 p.m. Free.
